attributes.action: establish a National Corrupt Officials Register
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There should be a ‘National Corrupt Officials Register’ to operate in a similar manner to the existing Sex Offenders Register to seek to prevent those found guilty of corruption or misconduct in public office from ever again being employed in public office.

There are currently no meaningful deterrents to those who behave corruptly and the same people are often censured by standards boards and other inquiries over and over again, yet remain in office.

Anyone in public office, including judges, magistrates, tribunal members, MPs, civil servants of any grade, ombudsmen and their staff, local government officials, councillors and any comparable office must be subject to this provision.

All entries on the register should be for life.

In order to ensure transparency, the register should be a publicly accessible document.

There must not be any exclusion from the register under ‘Public Interest Immunity’.

The register must not be maintained by a government body.

We therefore petition the Prime Minister to create a National Corrupt Officials Register onto which any public office holder can be put if they are found guilty of corruption, or any related offence.
